title: Pizza-Pasta Bake
description: Cook spaghetti in plenty of boiling salted water according to package instructions until al dente. Then pour cold water over pasta and drain well. Rinse and halve cherry tomatoes. Cut mozzarella into slices. Peel garlic and press through a press. Cut dried tomatoes into strips. Mix pasta with garlic, olive oil and cherry tomatoes. Roll pasta with a fork into nests and put into greased baking dish. Roll up slices of prosciutto ham and chorizo ​​and put between noodles. Top with dried tomatoes and mozzarella slices. Season with salt and ground pepper and bake until golden brown in preheated oven for 15-20 minutes.

title: Lasagne with Mixed Vegetables

Cook the onion, garlic and celery at low to medium heat for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with the sugar, caramelize and then deglaze with the vinegar. Add the pureed tomato seeds and vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Add the chickpeas and tomato chunks. Simmer for 3-5 minutes until almost boiling again.

title: Pasta with Spinach and Cheese
description: In a saucepan, sauté garlic in oil until golden. Add shallot and spinach and sauté until spinach has wilted. Deglaze with white wine and cream. Simmer over medium heat about 5 minutes. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Drain pasta and toss with spinach sauce. Divide pasta among warmed plates and serve with a dollop of cottage cheese.

title: Pasta with Smoked Salmon and Dill
description: Cut the salmon into thin strips. Peel the garlic and finely chop.

Season with salt and pepper and arrange on plates. Serve to taste with grated Parmesan.

title: Spaghetti with Cherry Tomatoes and Basil
description: Cook spaghetti in plenty of boiling salted water according to package instructions until al dente.

title: Lasagne with Zucchini, Scallops and Shrimp

title: Pappardelle Salad with Green Asparagus, Tomatoes, and Olives
description: Asparagus tastes best when it is freshly cut from the field. So keep it in the vegetable compartment of the fridge only as long as necessary and wrap it in a damp kitchen towel.

title: Spaghetti with Meat Sauce
description: You want to precook? No problem! The minced meat sauce can be kept in the refrigerator for 2-3 days or you can cook it right away and freeze the sauce. Simply put the cooled sauce into freezer bags and freeze it lying flat. This guarantees an even and fast freezing through. This also works wonderfully in flat tins.

title: Spinach Ravioli
description: Soak bread in water. Peel and mince 1 onion. Heat 1 tablespoon of butter in a pan and saute butter until translucent. Rinse spinach and boil in salted water. Drain, rinse, drain, squeeze and mince. Squeeze bread and add to spinach, sausage meat, marjoram, cooked onion, parsley and remaining egg. Season with salt, pepper, nutmeg and marjoram, to taste.

title: Pasta with Tomato and Olives Sauce

title: Grilled Eggplant with Pasta
description: Once again, rinse the eggplant in cold water, drain and pat dry. Spread the eggplant, tomatoes, onions, garlic and capers on a plate. Season with a little salt and plenty of pepper and drizzle with olive oil. Grill the vegetables on the top rail for 8-10 minutes.

title: Green Pasta with Blue Cheese
description: Cut Gorgonzola into small cubes. Peel and finely chop garlic. In a pan, sauté garlic in melted butter. Sprinkle with flour, stir in milk and cream and bring to a boil. Simmer, stirring occasionally, about 5 minutes. Remove pan from the heat and stir in Gorgonzola and half of the Parmesan. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.

title: Sauteed Vegetable Stack

Let rest for 10 minutes, then rinse with clean water and pat dry. Heat 8-10 tablespoons vegetable oil in a pan and brown eggplant on both sides. Remove and drain on paper towels and season with salt and pepper. Add a little more oil and cook zucchini slices until golden brown on both sides. Remove and drain on paper towels and season with salt and pepper.

title: Vegetable Lasagna
description: Rinse the bell peppers, cut in half, remove seeds and ribs and dice. Peel the onion and cut into cubes. Heat some oil in a pan and sauté the diced peppers with the onion for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and then set aside.

title: Spaghetti with Mushrooms
description: Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a skillet. Add the onion and chile and sauté for 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms and fry until golden, about 2-3 minutes. Deglaze the pan with the white wine and season with salt and pepper. Set aside.

title: Meat Lasagna

title: Vegetarian Lasagna
description: Cook the lasagna noodles in boiling salted water according to the package directions until al dente. Drain the noodles and drizzle with a few drops of oil. Peel and finely dice the carrots. Rinse, trim, and blanch the spinach in boiling salted water. Remove from the water and shock in an ice water bath. Squeeze well, and finely chop. Mix the spinach with the pine nuts and the ricotta. Peel and finely dice the shallot. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan. Sauté the shallots briefly, then sprinkle with the flour and stir until combined. Deglaze with the wine, then bring to a simmer. Simmer shortly, then stir in the cream and the creme fraiche. Season to taste with salt, pepper and nutmeg and set aside.

title: Tortellini with Mushroom Filling

Trim the mushrooms and finely chop, then sauté for 1-2 minutes with the garlic and thyme in butter. Add the mushroom mixture along with the egg to the potatoes. Mix well to combine. If the mixture is too moist, knead in a little cornstarch. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.

title: Pasta Salad with Arugula and Vegetables

description: It is best to choose the wholemeal version of pasta, as it contains significantly more vitamins, minerals and fibre than white flour pasta.

description: Pine nuts are very healthy, but unfortunately not a cheap pleasure either. If you want, you can also replace the kernels with nuts, such as walnuts or almonds. That tastes really good too!

Lift the morels from the soaking water and strain the water through a fine-meshed sieve. Add the morels to the pan along with the soaking liquid and the cream. description: Cook squid ink pasta in plenty of salted water until al dente and drain. Add pan contents to noodles, briefly mix, transfer to plates and serve immediately.

title: Vegetable Pasta Salad with Feta
description: Rinse the bell peppers, clean, cut in half, remove seeds and ribs and cut into fine strips. Peel, halve and also cut the onions into fine strips. Sauté the vegetables (zucchini, peppers and onions) in 2 tablespoons of heated olive oil for 5 - 8 minutes until they take on color. Add the vegetables with the finely chopped herbs to the pasta and season with balsamic vinegar, the remaining olive oil, salt and pepper to taste.

title: Pasta Gratins with Cheese and Herbs
description: Whisk cream with eggs, season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Butter 4 ovenproof ramekins (diameter of 10 cm) (approximately 4 inches) and arrange pasta, herbs and cheese in them. Pour egg cream over until pasta is covered to 3/4. Combine melted butter with breadcrumbs and sprinkle over pasta. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for about 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and serve immediately.

title: Pasta with Mushrooms and Tomatoes
description: Add mushrooms and peppers and sauté 3-4 minutes over medium heat. Stir in tomatoes and cook briefly. Season with salt and pepper. Drain pasta and add to pan. Stir in parsley and butter and toss to combine. Serve immediately. Top with grated pecorino cheese, if desired.

title: Pasta with Summer Squash and Beans
description: Rinse the squash, trim, cut in half lengthwise and cut into thin slices. Rinse the kidney beans through a colander and drain. Peel the garlic and finely chop. Blanch the tomatoes, cool in ice water peel the skin, quarter, core and cut into small cubes.

title: Meat Lasagna
description: Rinse onion, garlic, carrot and celery, Peel garlic and onion. Finely chop all vegetables. Fry onion and garlic in a pan with hot oil until translucent. Crumble minced meat into pan then add remaining vegetables. Stir in tomato paste and saute briefly. Deglaze with red wine and add tomatoes to pan. Let simmer about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until slightly thick. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Pasta with Peas, Pancetta and Mushroom
description: Cut the pancetta into strips. Peel the garlic and finely chop.

title: Lasagna with Shrimp, Calamari and Spinach
description: Rinse the king prawns, pat dry and cook in a hot pan with 1 tablespoon oil for 1-2 minutes. Combine with the octopus. Rinse the fish and pat dry. Cut the fish into small cubes and add to the octopus mixture.

title: Pasta with Artichoke Sauce
description: Meanwhile, cook the spaghetti in plenty of boiling salted water according to the package label until al dente. Drain the tomatoes and cut into very thin strips. Rinse the capers with water and add to the cooking artichokes after about 10 minutes. Finally, season the sauce with pepper, chile and sea salt. Drain the spaghetti, mix with the artichoke sauce, add half of the parsley and half of the parmesan and season to taste. Serve on warmed plates and sprinkle with parmesan, sundried tomatoes, olives and parsley. Drizzle with remaining lemon juice and serve hot.

title: Pumpkin Ravioli with Cheese Filling

title: Pumpkin Ravioli

Whish together the eggs and the cream and season with salt and cayenne pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the pasta. Crumble the goat cheese and sprinkle over the pasta.

title: Pumpkin Lasagna

Stir in the Parmesan and season with salt, pepper, nutmeg and curry powder to taste. Spread some of the vegetable mixture on the bottom of the baking dish, cover with lasagna sheets. Continue until all lasagna is used. Complete the last layer with pumpkin and top with the Gouda. Bake in preheated oven on the middle shelf for 40-50 minutes.

If you are in a bit of a hurry, you can also use ready ribbon noodles.

title: Penne All'Arrabiata
description: Cook the penne in boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Vegetable Lasagna
description: Meanwhile, for the vegetable sauce: Peel the onion and garlic, dice the onion and finely chop the garlic. Peel the carrots and dice. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large saucepan, sauté the vegetables and garlic until softened, add the tomato paste, cook briefly then deglaze with the wine. Add the diced tomatoes and lentils and simmer for about 10 minutes.

title: Pasta with Zucchini, Chives and Pink Pepper
description: Peel and halve onion, cut into strips. Heat oil in a pan and saute onion, stirring, for a few minutes. Rinse parsley, shake dry and cut leaves into thin strips. Rinse chives, shake dry and cut into small rings. Pat dry anchovies, chop coarsely and add to onion, mash slightly.  Rinse and trim zucchini, cut into long strips with a vegetable peeler. Add to the pan and mix well, saute for 1-2 minutes. Add lemon zest with herbs and drained pasta, toss well and season with salt and pepper.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry with Pasta
description: The quick pasta recipe actually lends itself to Meal-Prep, meaning you can take the fried vegetables with noodles to work the next day, reheat them there or enjoy them as a noodle-vegetable salad. The noodles with vegetables leave room for creativity and the use of leftovers. If you have other vegetables left over, you can easily add them to the pasta.

title: Zucchini Pasta with Anchovies
description: If you don't like anchovies, you can add dried tomatoes, bacon or even shrimps to the pasta. If you need some sauce, you can mix 4-5 tablespoons of the pasta water with 100 ml of whipped cream and add it to the pasta.

title: Macaroni with Parmesan Cheese
description: Rinse and dry the sage. Remove the leaves and coarsely chop. Melt the butter in a pan, add the sage, and let brown slightly. Drain the pasta and add to the pan. Add a little pasta water if necessary. Season to taste with lemon juice and pepper.

title: Pasta with Cabbage Thistle and Zucchini
description: Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until al dente. Heat the oil in a large saucepan and sauté the garlic and chile until fragrant. Reduce the heat to low, add the squash and sauté for 1-2 minutes. Add the thistle and cook until wilted. Add the mandarin orange pieces and juice and season with salt, pepper and nutmeg. Add the pasta and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to serving plates and serve garnished with borage flowers.

title: Farfalle with Cod, Asparagus and Snow Peas
description: For the farfalle: Cook the farfalle in a pot of boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Spaghetti with Summer Vegetable and Feta
description: For the spaghetti, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta, green beans and carrot slices to the pot and cook for about 8 minutes (or according to instructions on the package) until al dente. After about 3 minutes, add broccoli, summer squash and bell peppers.

title: Pasta with Green Asparagus and Cheese Sauce
description: For the sauce, peel shallots and garlic and chop finely. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a pot and saute shallots and garlic together until soft. Sprinkle with flour and saute briefly, deglaze the pot with broth and cream and simmer for about 5 minutes, while gently stirring until smooth. Remove the pot from the heat, add 1 tablespoon butter and Parmesan and puree the sauce with an immersion blender and season with salt and pepper.

title: Pasta Salad with Cheese and Eggplant
description: Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until al dente, drain, rinse in cold water and drain. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a frying pan and fry the eggplant 2-3 minutes. Pour in the broth and cook until soft over medium heat for 5-7 minutes. Then remove from heat and let cool.

title: Tagliatelle with Spicy Tomato Sauce
description: Chop olives. Rinse, core and chop tomatoes. Add olive, fresh tomatoes and the canned tomatoes to the pan. Season with salt, pepper, espelette pepper and cumin. Simmer over low heat, about 10 minutes.

title: Pasta with Garlic and Fresh Mushrooms

title: Vegetable Lasagna

title: Shrimp Scampi with Pasta
description: A balanced diet includes vegetables. This is missing in the pasta with shrimps, so serve a mixed leaf salad as a side dish or serve a delicious tomato soup as an appetizer. title: Noodles with Chile and Asparagus
description: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions for about 8-10 minutes until al dente and drain. While the spaghetti is cooking, place oil in a large frying pan. Add butter, chile, and asparagus. Cook briefly and season with salt, pepper and lemon juice. Add the drained spaghetti, mix together until warm and serve on plates. Serve with sprinkled parsley and paprika.

title: Pasta with Kale and Prosciutto
description: Cook the pasta in plenty of salted water for about 8 minutes until al dente. Cook slices of prosciutto in olive oil for about 1 minute until crispy. Drain the pasta and mix immediately with the kale. Transfer to plates, sprinkle with plenty of Parmesan, top each portion with 1-2 slices of prosciutto and serve immediately.

title: Linguine with Monkfish
description: Rinse monkfish, pat dry and cut into bite-sized pieces. Rinse and peel carrots. Rinse zucchini. Rinse and halve bell pepper, remove seeds and ribs. Julienne all vegetables. Peel shallots and garlic peel, cut into slices.

title: Penne with Spinach, Roasted Chestnuts and Bacon

title: Pasta Salad with Shrimp and Arugula

title: Noodles with Vegetables and Cream Sauce

title: Lasagne with Lamb and Vegetables

Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg and simmer over low heat, stirring occasionally for 15 minutes. Stir in 1 tablespoon Parmesan.

title: Penne with Tuna

Add tomatoes, capers and red pepper, saute briefly, puree with an immersion blender and simmer for another 3-4 minutes. If needed, add a little pasta water to reach desired consistency and season with salt and pepper. Drain pasta. Add pasta and tuna to the pan, mix together with the sauce, heat slightly and season with salt and pepper. Serve on plates and serve garnished with Parmesan.

title: Zucchini Strips with Tuna
description: If you have a little more time, you can prepare this with pan-seared fresh tuna or salmon.

description: Fry ground beef in oil until browned and crumbly. Add onion, garlic, peppers and celery and sauté briefly. Add tomatoes and broth. Simmer on low heat about 20 minutes.

description: Cook the pasta according to the package instructions in salt water until al dente.

title: Penne with Broccoli and Sausage

title: Pasta Salad with Chicken, Tomatoes and Basil

title: Pasta with Shitake Mushroom Sauce
description: Peel the garlic and finely chop. Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Baked Pasta with Broccoli, Cheese and Sausage
description: Precook penne in boiling salted water for about 8 minutes. Rinse with cold water and drain well.

title: Pasta with Vegetable Sauce
description: Peel and finely chop carrots, kohlrabi and celery root. Rinse celery and cut into small cubes.

title: Pappardelle with Mushroom Sauce
description: Clean the mushrooms, wipe with a paper towel and cut into slices or strips. Peel the garlic and the shallots, chop finely, and sweat in a hot pan with oil until translucent. Add the mushrooms and cook until they have released their liquid and it has evaporated. Season with salt and pepper, then add the pasta. Add the parsley and parmesan, and toss everything thoroughly to combine. Serve on warmed plates garnished with the watercress.

title: Meat Ravioli with Onions
description: For the filling: Meanwhile, tear the bread into pieces and soak in the warm milk. Peel and finely dice 1 onion. Heat the butter in a skillet, and sauté the onion until translucent. Rinse the spinach and  blanch in a pot of boiling salted water until wilted. Drain, rinse under cold water, drain again and squeeze well water and chop finely. Transfer to a bowl. Squeeze the bread and add to the bowl along with onion, meat and egg and mix well. Season well with salt, pepper and nutmeg.

title: Spaghetti with Smoked Pork, Mushrooms and Cabbage
description: Rinse savoy cabbage, trim, cut into strips and blanch in a pot of boiling salted water for about 3 minutes until al dente. Drain, rinse in cold water and drain again.

title: Colorful Pasta Salad
description: For the dressing, mix the oil, tomato paste, vinegar and mustard. Season with salt, pepper and sugar.

title: Creamy Vegetable Noodle Casserole
description: Rinse the zucchini, peel the carrots and grate coarsely both. Halve the leek lengthwise, rinse, trim and thinly slice. Melt 1/2 of the butter in a saucepan and sauté the vegetables for 3 minutes. Cook the noodles in boiling salted water for about 5 minutes, drain, rinse under cold water until cool and drain again. Peel the garlic, mince and add to the vegetables. Add the pasta and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Grease a large baking dish and fill with the noodle mixture. Whisk together the crème fraîche, eggs, cream and 1/2 of the cheese and pour over the noodles. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese and bake for about 25 minutes, until golden brown. Serve immediately.

title: Italian Vegetable Soup
description: Heat the oil and bacon in a large saucepan. Sweat the onion and garlic for 1-2 minutes, add the drained beans and remaining vegetables. Add the broth, season with salt and pepper, cover and simmer over low heat for about 40 minutes. Blanch the tomatoes, rinse under cold water, cut into quarters and add to the soup. Add the spaghetti and simmer for 10-15 minutes.

title: Pasta with Salmon and Lemon Balm Sauce
description: Cook the linguine in boiling salted water according to package directions until al dente.

title: Spicy Spaghetti with Cod
description: Meanwhile, sauté garlic, chile peppers and Hungarian pepper in hot oil, add tomato paste and sauté briefly, then add broth and lime juice. Mix in Parmesan and season with salt and pepper.

title: Whole Wheat Pasta with Tomatoes and Basil
description: Add ham and pasta to the sauce and mix well. Season with salt and pepper and transfer to plates. Sprinkle with pepper and garnish with basil. Serve.

title: Braised Beef Roulades with Feta and Peppers
description: Arrange the beef cutlets on a work surface, gently pound flat and season with salt and pepper. On the lower third of each cutlet, place the pepper strips next to each other, then top with a cheese strip and some herbs. Roll the beef around the filling and secure with kitchen twine, then season with salt and pepper.

title: Filled Pasta with Chard and Cheese in Melted Butter
description: For the filling, rinse swiss chard, trim and blanch in a pot of boiling salted water. Drain, rinse with cold water, drain again and chop finely.

title: Tagliatelle with Chicken and Olives
description: Cook pappardelle in a pot of salted water until al dente.

title: Hazelnut Pasta Bake
description: Place breadcrumbs, grated lemon peel, cinnamon, sugar and cocoa in a large bowl and mix well. Toss with tagliatelle in the bowl. Melt butter over low heat and add to bowl. Mix ingredients together and season with lemon juice.

title: Pasta with Zucchini and Tomatoes
description: Rinse and trim the zucchini and cut into pieces. Rinse the tomatoes, cut into quarters, remove the seeds and dice. Peel and finely chop the garlic. Sauté everything briefly in some oil.

title: Pasta with Asparagus, Ham and Parmesan
description: For the filling, blanch the asparagus tips in boiling salted water with lime juice until al dente, about 8 minutes, rinse under ice-cold water and drain. Rinse and halve the cherry tomatoes and set a pair of tomatoes aside. Cut the ham into strips and cook individual slices in a pan with 1 tablespoon butter until crispy, then set aside.

title: Orzo Pasta with Saffron, Stockfish and Vegetables
description: Also soak the chickpeas overnight, then cook in simmering salted water about 45 minutes. Blanch the green beans, plunge into salt water and drain. Rinse the peppers, cut in half, trim and cut into very thin strips. Peel the onion and finely chop. Add the saffron threads to the white wine. Sweat the onion in 2 tablespoons hot oil, then add the pasta and pepper strips and deglaze with the saffron-white wine. Simmer for about 5 minutes, while stirring. Gradually pour in the vegetable broth and let the pasta absorb the liquid. Then add the chickpeas, beans, sage and the fish and simmer, stirring for about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and serve drizzled with olive oil and sprinkled with cayenne pepper.

title: Ricotta Ravioli with Sage Butter

title: Pasta with Cabbage and Potatoes
description: Peel and thinly slice the garlic.

title: Pasta Salad with Shrimp
description: Rinse the basil, shake dry, and reserve a few leaves for garnish. Chop remainder. Drain mushrooms and add to the shrimp in the skillet. Add remaining ingredients to the pan, mix well, and season to taste.

title: Pasta with Broccoli
description: Cook the pasta in plenty of boiling salt water until al dente. Drain the pasta and mix with the vegetables. Serve sprinkled with parmesan.

title: Mediterranean Pasta Salad
description: For the vinaigrette, mix 4 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, salt and pepper. Toss arugula, beans, tomatoes and scallions together. Drizzle with vinaigrette. Serve salad with penne pasta and hard-boiled eggs on plates. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

title: Ricotta Herb Tortellini
description: For the pesto, toast pine nuts until golden brown in a dry pan and let cool. Rinse the basil leaves, pat dry and pluck the leaves. Combine the basil, peeled garlic, pine nuts, parmesan and olive oil in a blender and process until a creamy.

title: Mushroom Pasta with Lemon Sauce
description: 60 mins

title: Spicy Turkey Coconut Soup with Glass Noodles
description: Heat the oil in a Dutch oven, and saute the turkey meat, chile pepper and scallions briefly. Add the coconut milk and broth and simmer 5 minutes. Cut the glass noodles into pieces and add to the soup. Stir in the lemon juice and soy sauce, season with salt and pepper. Rinse the cilantro, shake dry, pluck off the leaves and sprinkle on the soup before serving.

title: Herb Pasta with Feta Cheese
description: 50 mins

title: Pasta Salad
description: Drain the pasta, rinse in cold water, drain and mix with the dressing.

title: Braised Cabbage with Potato Noodles
description: Peel and dice the onions and garlic and sauté in some olive oil. Add the cabbage and carrots and cook briefly. Pour in the broth and the beans, mix well and season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook in a preheated oven at 200ºC (approximately 400ºF / gas: level 3-4) for about 40 minutes.

title: Penne with Asparagus and Red Bell Pepper
description: Rinse and quarter pepper, remove seeds and ribs and cut into pieces. Chop walnuts. Cook penne in salted boiling water until al dente, according to package instructions.

title: Zucchini Noodle Casserole

title: Pasta with Peas and Prosciutto
description: Cut prosciutto into thin strips. Peel garlic and chop finely. Heat oil in a pan and briefly sweat garlic along with prosciutto. Add cream and a little pasta water to deglaze pan. Add peas and simmer 2 to 3 minutes. Mix in dill and season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Pasta with Shrimp and Asparagus
description: Cook pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Drain, reserving some of the cooking water.

title: Pappardelle with Mushrooms
description: Peel and finely dice the garlic. Peel the shallot, halve lengthwise, and julienne.

title: Tortellini with Cream Cheese Filling
description: The tortellini are versatile: you can, for example, toss the finished tortellini in sage butter and grate parmesan over it, or cook a fresh tomato sauce with it.

title: Pumpkin Ravioli with Zucchini Blossoms
description: For the filling, bring salted water to a boil. Cut the pumpkin flesh into cubes and cook for about 15 minutes, until very soft. Drain and place in the dry pot. Cook over low heat for another 5 minutes, until the pieces are nice and dry, then leave to cool. Peel the onion and chop coarsely. Grate the Parmesan coarsely and mash together with the onion and ground almonds. Mash the pumpkin finely. Combine everything with the mustard and egg and season to taste with salt, pepper and nutmeg.

title: Vegetable Lasagna with Feta Cheese
description: Boil lasagna noodles in salted water until al dente. Assemble lasagna on warmed plates. Fold lasagna sheets into 4 layers. Between each layer spread tomatoes, zucchini and feta. Season with fresh pepper and place tomatoes with stems on top. Garnish with basil and serve immediately.

title: Tagliatelle with Pumpkin Cream Sauce
description: Peel the onion and cut into rings. Spread the onions on an oiled baking sheet. Sprinkle with the powdered sugar, and drizzle with the balsamic vinegar. Bake in the oven for 1 hour until crispy. Stir occasionally during the cook time. Be careful that the onions don't burn, because they can turn bitter.

title: Quick Macaroni and Cheese
description: 70 mins

title: Penne with Fresh Pesto
description: Drain the penne and place in a bowl. Mix in the pesto, and toss until combined. Place the pasta onto plates, garnish with fresh basil, and serve.

title: Pasta with Prawns and Asparagus
description: Cook pasta in a pot of boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Tomato and Kidney Bean Pasta with Basil
description: Heat the olive oil and butter in a saucepan and sauté the pepper, onions and garlic, stirring. Add the chopped tomatoes, kidney beans and oregano, season with salt and pepper and bring to a boil. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes.

title: Spinach and Ricotta Ravioli with Sage Butter
description: In order to prevent the pasta from tasting too bland, the filling should be strongly seasoned. 1 teaspoon of filling per ravioli is sufficient. Alternatively, you can also use a piping bag for perfect portioning.

title: White Truffle Pasta
description: Meanwhile, peel the garlic and chop finely. Roll out the dough thinly on a floured work surface. Fold the dough over and roll out again. Repeat 3 times. Roll out the dough thinly and sprinkle with flour. Roll up and cut into 1 cm (approximately 1/3 inch) wide strips.

title: Penne with Tomato-Eggplant Sauce
description: Rinse and dice tomatoes. Stir tomatoes into eggplant mixture. Cook pasta in plenty of salted boiling water until al dente. Drain pasta and mix with sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Divide pasta among plates and serve garnished with basil and Parmesan.

title: Pasta with Thyme-Chestnut Mushrooms
description: Rinse, trim and thinly slice the scallions into long strips. Rinse the thyme and the basil, shake dry and pluck the leaves. Coarsely chop the basil leaves.

title: Spring Pasta with Chicken and White Asparagus
description: Wash the chicken breasts, pat dry, and chop. Peel the onion and garlic and chop finely and sauté in oil. Add chicken cubes and sauté for 2 to 3 minutes. Deglaze with the wine. Add asparagus and 4 to 5 tablespoons boiling water and simmer for 1 to 2 minutes.

title: Spicy Spaghetti with Arugula and Tuna
description: Rinse chile pepper, remove seeds and cut into fine pieces. Drain the tuna and tear into pieces. Sauté shallots and garlic in hot olive oil, add tuna and chile pepper, sauté briefly and season with salt and pepper.

title: Pasta with Crayfish and Lemon Sauce
description: Peel garlic and chop finely. Heat butter in a pan and saute garlic briefly. Add flour and cook for a few seconds, add fish stock. Bring to a boil and add cream and lenghwise halved lemon. Simmer, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes. Remove lemon from sauce and puree finely with an immersion blender. Season with salt and pepper. Add crayfish, dill and drained pasta, heat through and place into bowls. Serve.

title: Pasta with Chanterelle Mushrooms, Ricotta and Bacon
description: Heat butter in a pan and saute onion and garlic until soft. Clean chanterelle and add to onion mixture. Cook bacon until goden yellow in a dry pan and drain on paper towels.

title: Rye Noodles with Sprouts and Mushroom Sauce
description: For the sauce: Meanwhile, trim mushrooms and cut into slices. Peel shallot and finely chop. Rinse sprouts in cold water and drain well. Rinse and trim celery and cut diagonally into very small pieces.

title: Spinach and Chicken Lasagna
description: Precook the lasagna noodles in boiling salted water until al dente. Rinse in cold water, drain well and drizzle and with a few drops of oil. Peel and press the garlic. Rinse and trim the spinach and blanch in salted water. Quench in ice water, drain, squeeze out the excess water and chop. Stir the spinach together with the pine nuts, garlic, and ricotta, and season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Rinse the chicken breasts, pat dry, and chop. Peel the garlic and chop finely. Saute for 1-2 minutes with the chicken in 2 tablespoons hot oil. Season with salt and pepper and set aside. Rinse the tomatoes, cut out the stems and cut the flesh into slices. Peel the shallot, chop finely and fry in 2 tablespoons hot oil. Sprinkle with the flour and deglaze with the white wine. Simmer briefly and add the cream and the crème fraîche. Season with salt and nutmeg and set aside.

title: Cannelloni Stuffed with Spinach
description: Peel garlic and halve lengthwise. Peel onion and chop finely. Peel carrot and chop. Heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil in a saucepan and saute onion, garlic and carrot on low heat. Add 150 ml (approximately 5 ounces) of water and tomatoes and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5-6 minutes on low heat. Season with salt, pepper, nutmeg and cinnamon.

title: Ravoli with Ricotta and Pesto
description: For the dough, stir together flour, eggs, egg yolks, oil and salt then knead with hands until smooth. If necessary add a little cold water or flour to get a pliable dough. Form a ball, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for about 30 minutes.

title: Green Pasta with Mushrooms
description: For a spicy finish, you can grate some parmesan cheese over the green pasta with mushrooms - in addition, you get more protein in the dish.

description: Arrange the pork with the sauce and the pasta on plates and sprinkle with the remaining herbs. Serve immediately.

description: Cook tagliatelle in a pot of boiling salted water according to package directions until al dente. Then drain and allow to cool briefly.

description: Rinse cabbage, trim and cut into pieces. Blanch in boiling salted water, rinse and drain.

description: Combine the pressed garlic, the cheese, eggs and milk in a blender and blend until smooth. Mix the spinach with the pasta, salt and pepper and place in the oiled baking dish. Pour the egg mixture over the pasta evenly and bake in preheated oven at 180°C (approximately 350°F) for about 20 minutes. title: Spaghetti with Sun-dried Tomatoes and Purslane
description: Season vegetables with salt and pepper, add the drained spaghetti and 1-2 tablespoons of the tomato oil, and cook over low heat while stirring. Garnish spaghetti with the purslane and shaved Parmesan. Serve immediately.

title: Shell Pasta with Prawns and Kiwi
description: Peel and finely chop the shallots. Rinse and trim the bell peppers, remove seeds and ribs and dice finely. Rinse and trim the tomatoes and zucchini and cut into small cubes. Peel the kiwis and cut into small pieces.

title: Pasta with Creamy Ham and Pea Sauce
description: Sweat the shallot in butter until translucent. Squeeze the garlic. Add the garlic and ham to the shallot and saute briefly. Add the peas and pour in the cream. title: Pasta with Spinach, Bacon and Garlic
description: Cook the pasta in plenty of salted water until al dente (collect about 1 cup of cooking water afterwards).

title: Vegetable Pasta Casserole
description: Melt the butter in a small saucepan. Stir in the flour. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly. Bring to boil and add the cream, cheese and broth. Add water, if necessary. Mix the broccoli pasta, shrimp, tomatoes, chives and sauce. Stir in 2/3 of the herbs.

title: Baked Pasta with Peppers and Almonds
description: Transfer pasta and vegetables to a round baking dish and sprinkle with almonds. Rinse parsley and set 1 sprig aside. Finely chop the rest. Mix eggs with cream, Parmesan and chopped parsley and pour mixture over the pasta. Cut mozzarella into cubes and sprinkle over the top. Bake in an oven preheated to 180°C (approximately 350°F) until top is golden-brown, about 35 minutes. Garnish with remaining parsley leaves.

title: Seafood Pasta
description: Add tomatoes and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil. Stir in creme fraiche and reduce heat. Season with salt, pepper and herbs. Cook fettuccine in boiling salted water until al dente. Drain and serve immediately with the sauce.

title: Green Pasta with Mushrooms and Pine Nuts
description: Rinse and chop the scallions and blanch for 3 minutes. Rinse and drain.

title: Tagliatelle with Chicken and Cream Sauce
description: Cook the pasta in plenty of salted water until al dente. Cut the bacon into strips and fry in a dry skillet until crispy.

title: Tagliatelle with Green Asparagus
description: Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a skillet and saute the garlic until golden. Add the asparagus and pancetta, and lightly saute in hot oil.

title: Monkfish Lasagna
description: Cook lasagna noodles in plenty of boiling salted water until al dente, then drain.

title: Spaghetti with Zucchini Sauce and Seared Steak
description: Sear the steak for 4-5 minutes. Remove and wrap with aluminum foil to keep warm. Add the onions to the pan and cook until translucent. Press the garlic cloves through a garlic press and add to the pan along with the zucchini and oregano. Cook until the zucchini is soft. Add the cooked spaghetti and sour cream to the skillet and toss until combined. Serve the spaghetti on plates along with the steaks.

title: Pasta with Fennel and Ham
description: Cook spaghetti in plenty of boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Tortellini Salad
description: Rinse parsley and basil and cut the leaves into thin strips. Mix creme fraiche with mayonnaise and 4 tablespoons mozzarella. Season with salt and pepper. Mix in remaining vinegar. Combine tortellini, scallions and mozzarella mix. Stir in herbs and drizzle with cream mixture to serve.

title: Greek-style Pasta Casserole
description: Stir tomato paste and chopped tomatoes with liquid from can into meat mixture. Sprinkle meat mixture with parsley, season with salt and pepper, cover and simmer over low heat until sauce is thickened and reduced, 30-35 minutes. Remove meat mixture from heat and let cool.

title: Pappardelle with Vegetables
description: Cook pappardelle according to package instructions and drain. For the sauce, mix cream cheese with quark, oil and lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Fold vegetable strips into the sauce and mix with pappardelle. Sprinkle with Parmesan. Garnish with remaining basil sprigs.

title: Farfalle with Cheese Sauce
description: Peel the garlic and pass through a press. Coarsely grate the parmesan cheese, and set half aside for garnish. Cut the gorgonzola into cubes. Add the gorgonzola, ricotta, cornstarch, the remaining parmesan, the broth, and a little cream in a saucepan. Heat the mixture until the cheese has melted, and a creamy sauce has formed. Add more cream, if necessary, and simmer until thickened. Season to taste with pepper. The sauce shouldn't need salt, but if necessary, taste the sauce and season lightly.

title: Pasta with Asparagus
description: Peel shallot and chop finely. Melt butter in a pan and sweat shallots. Deglaze pan with wine and add reserved pasta water. Simmer 2 to 3 minutes. Add saffron and stir in crème fraîche. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add tagliatelle and asparagus to sauce mixture and heat through. Serve on plates.

title: Savory Spaghetti Pie
description: Rinse the broccoli and the Brussles sprouts, trim and halve the Brusells sprouts. Blanch both together in salted water for about 4 minutes. Remove from water, rinse with cold water and drain well. Rinse, trim and chop the summer squash into small pieces. Rinse the parsley, shake dry, pluck the leaves and finely chop.

title: Ground Meat and Macaroni Bake
description: Peel onion and garlic and chop finely. Blanch tomatoes, peel, quarter, core and dice.

title: Pasta Salad with Beans, Chilie Pepper and Avocado
description: Halve the avocado, remove the pit, dice pulp and mash together with lemon juice, pressed clove of garlic and sour cream. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

title: Pasta with Salmon Sauce
description: Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente. Heat butter in a pan and saute onion and garlic until soft. Deglaze pan with wine and simmer down slightly. Then add broth, lemon zest and crème fraîche and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and add salmon, cook for about 5 minutes. Season sauce with salt, pepper, nutmeg and lemon juice.

title: Cannelloni with Mushroom and Ricotta Filling
description: Preheat the oven to 200°C (approximately 400°F). Rinse tomatoes, coarsely chop and mix in a bowl with wine and remaining olive oil and season with a bit of pepper. Spread tomato mixture over filled cannelloni. Sprinkle with remaining mozzarella. Bake in preheated oven for 30-35 minutes. Serve garnished with basil leaves.

title: Blinis with Elderberries, Apples and Yogurt
description: Place the flour, 2 tablespoons of sugar and 1 pinch of salt in a mixing bowl. Pour in the yeast-milk, along with the rapeseed oil and melted butter and mix thoroughly. Leave to stand for about 1 hour.

title: Pasta with Spicy Tomato Sauce
description: 45 mins

title: Tagliatelle with Broad Beans, Spinach and Pesto
description: Instead of broad beans, green beans can also be used for this ribbon noodle dish. If spinach is not available fresh, for example, you can also use frozen goods.

title: Creamy Celery Mustard Sauce
description: 45 mins

title: Asian Fried Noodles
description: Vegetables and eggs provide a good portion of minerals. Together with the crunchy peanuts, they provide a third of your daily fiber requirement on the plate. Not only do peanuts taste delicious, but they also contain a lot of vegetable protein, fat, and other important nutrients such as protein and calcium, which plants often do not provide enough of.

title: Pasta Vegetable Casserole
description: Feel free to vary the mixture of vegetables depending on your taste and the season!

title: Farfalle Pasta with Cabbage
description: One serving contains plenty of vitamin B12, B6 and folic acid. Together, they lower the homocysteine level in the blood. An elevated level of homocysteine can cause damage to the blood vessels and is associated with dementia in old age. This pasta is also a great source of calcium and fiber.

title: Tomato Pasta with Zucchini
description: Cooked, pureed tomatoes are abundant in lycopene, which is extremely good for the body. Among other things, it reduces the risk of infection and can help protect the skin from harmful UV rays.

description: Tomatoes are rich in lycopene, an antioxidant that protects our cells from free radicals. The colourful vegetable mixture, together with the wholemeal lasagne plates, provides a lot of fibre, which ensures that the lasagne will fill you up for a really long time.

title: Pasta Cabbage Casserole
description: Are you looking for more recipes with the healthy pointed cabbage? Then take a look at our cookbook on the delicious vegetables. To pimp the vegetarian noodle and pointed cabbage casserole with a little vegetable protein, you can cook about 150 grams of frozen peas together with the cabbage and carrots and then gratinate them.

title: Spaghetti with Gorgonzola Sauce
description: If you do not tolerate lactose well, you can enjoy the cheese, as it naturally contains very little lactose. Use lactose-free cream or soy cream as an alternative. Refine the dish with chopped nuts, seeds or fresh spinach. The Italian cheese is made from pasteurized milk, but pregnant women should not eat it raw, because listeria bacteria can multiply due to the low acidity and the noble mould. In the pasta, however, the cheese is cooked and can therefore be eaten without hesitation. If in doubt, cook the sauce a little longer.

title: Pasta Gratin with Tomatoes, Eggplant and Mushrooms
description: Clean mushrooms and cut into quarters. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a pan and saute garlic with mushrooms. Blanch tomatoes in hot water, rinse in cold water and peel, quarter and remove seeds, chop coarsely. Rinse and dry scallions and cut into thin rings. Butter baking dish and layer eggplants, pasta, mushrooms and tomatoes. Sprinkle with scallions. Rinse parsely and chop finely. Combine cheese with cream, season with salt and pepper. Pour cream mixture over gratin and sprinkle with parsley. Bake in preheated oven at 200°C (approximately 400°F) for about 35 minutes. Serve immediately.

title: Gorgonzola and Spinach Pasta
description: Soya cream ensures the beautiful creamy consistency of the sauce here - and brings two advantages at once: It has only half as much fat as whipped cream and contains no cholesterol. The spicy blue cheese provides a thick portion of bone-strengthening calcium.

description: Nutrition experts advise eating sea fish or crustaceans twice a week to cover the iodine requirements. description: You can add in some grilled chicken or bacon for more protein, or you can serve it on the side of a main dish like barbecued chicken.

title: Pasta with Spinach and Smoked Salmon
description: In a small saucepan, bring cream, saffron and instant broth to a boil. Add spinach, garlic and salmon to sauce and cook until warmed through.

title: Pasta with Cauliflower, Cherry Tomatoes, and Anchovies
description: Meanwhile, in a skillet heat 3 tablespoons oil and dissolve the anchovies, then add the garlic and sauté. Add cauliflower to skillet and cook over medium heat until lightly browned, then crush with a fork. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle in the oregano. Stir in the creme fraiche, 2-3 tablespoons of the cooking water and 2 tablespoons grated pecorino. Season with salt pepper. Add pasta and cherry tomatoes to skillet and toss to combine. Arrange on plates and sprinkle with more grated pecorino. Serve immediately.

title: Tortellini Salad
description: Mix yogurt with mayonnaise, lemon juice, basil, salt and pepper. Add tortellini, scallions and tomatoes to salad bowl and mix with yogurt sauce. Season with salt, pepper and a little lemon juice. Cut bologna sausage into cubes and fold into tortellini salad. Let stand for 5 minutes, stir and serve garnished with basil leaves.

title: Fusilli with Corn and Ham
description: Boil the pasta in plenty of salted water until al dente. Get a small bowl to catch some of the water, drain off and set aside for later. Immediately mix the pasta with butter, cream, corn, ham and chives. Mix 2-3 tablespoons in the cooking water, then pepper generously, salt slightly if necessary and serve immediately.

title: Pasta with Swiss Chard and Beets
description: Rinse, clean and spin dry the chard. Cut the stalks into 1 cm (approximately 1/4 inch) wide pieces, and slice the leaves into 2 cm (approximately 3/4 inch) wide pieces.

description: Rinse the potatoes and cook for about 1 hour in the preheated oven. Remove, cool slightly, peel and press through a ricer. While the potatoes are still warm, knead in the butter, cornstarch, and yolks. If the dough is too sticky, incorporate some flour and season with salt and nutmeg.

title: Vegetable Lasagna
description: Rinse mushrooms, pat dry and chop. Rinse broccoli and cut into small pieces.

title: Pumpkin Cannelloni
description: If you cannot find Pumpkin you can use orange butternut squash which includes a high amount of beta-carotene. It serves as cell protection and is also converted in the body into vitamin A, which helps with eyesight. The potassium, which is abundant in this recipe, lowers blood pressure and is beneficial for the heart.

title: Baked Pasta with White Cabbage and Ham
description: Remove foil, increase oven temperature to 190°C (approximately 375°F) and bake for about 15 minutes more or until golden brown. Remove from the oven, let rest briefly and serve.

title: Cannelloni Stuffed with Spinach and Ricotta
description: Fill a piping bag with a large tip with spinach-ricotta mixture and fill cannelloni with it. Place filled cannelloni in the baking dish, cover with remaining tomatoes and sliced mozzarella and season again with salt, pepper and oregano. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes. Meanwhile, trim lettuce, rinse, spin dry and tear into bite sized pieces. Mix oil in a bowl with vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Place prepared lettuce in a bowl and mix with vinaigrette. Serve salad with baked cannelloni.

title: Linguine with Leek and Lemon Sauce
description: Peel and finely dice the shallot. Heat the butter in a pan and sauté the shallot. Add the flour, sauté briefly, then deglaze with the lemon juice and let simmer. Add the broth and the cream, stirring to combine. Let simmer for 10 minutes, stirring until thickened.

title: Vegetarian Lasagna
description: Rinse the tomatoes, remove the cores, and finely dice. Peel the carrots, halve crosswise, and thinly slice or shave. Rinse and trim the peppers. Halve the peppers and julienne. Rinse, trim, and thinly slice the zucchini. Clean and slice the mushrooms. Peel and finely dice the garlic. Heat the oil in a pan, then sauté the garlic with the carrots and peppers. Season to taste with salt and pepper and remove from the heat.

title: Lasagna with Gravlax and Spinach
description: Blanch tomatoes in boiling water, remove, peel, quarter, core and dice.

title: Chinese Savory Pastries
description: Without dough there are no filled dumplings - but with a few tips the preparation is very easy. The temperature of the water is important; it should be warm but not boiling. The texture of the dough then becomes more elastic. In addition, do not add all the water directly to the flour, but prepare it slowly. This is the best way for the flour to combine with the liquid. And knead well afterwards!

title: Rice Noodles with Turkey Breast
description: Rice noodles contain hardly any fat and still make you feel full. The peppers provide a thick portion of vitamin C and, together with celery and peanut kernels, also provide satiating fibre.

title: Whole-Grain Spinach Pasta with Feta and Chickpea Filling
description: For the filling, crumble the feta. Rinse the chickpeas and drain. Peel the garlic, chop finely and mix with the chickpeas, feta, egg, mint, and goat cheese. Season with salt and pepper.

title: Pumpkin Soup with Ground Beef and Noodles
description: Heat oil in a saucepan and cook ground beef until crumbly. Season well with salt and pepper. Add pumpkin and saute for 2 minutes. Sprinkle with curry powder and add vegetable broth, orange juice and cream. Bring to a boil, add noodles and cook until tender. Stir occasionally. Season with soy sauce and cayenne pepper. Serve.

title: Spaghetti with Meatballs and Tomato Sauce
description: Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Polenta Vegetable Lasagne
description: Rinse tomatoes, remove stems and cores and finely dice.

title: Pasta with Tuna and Spinach Sauce
description: Rinse spinach, trim and spin dry. Peel garlic and chop finely. Sauté briefly in a skillet in hot olive oil. Add spinach and stir well, allowing liquid to evaporate. Stir in the cream cheese with the cream until smooth and thoroughly mixed with spinach. Adjust heat to keep sauce hot but do not allow it to boil. Stir in well-drained, flaked tuna, reheat and season with salt and pepper.
types: ['leafy green vegetable', 'Dough', 'Spring', 'Spring Dish', 'Spring Vegetable', 'date night', 'Fish', 'saltwater\xa0Fish', 'Vegetable', 'Pasta', 'Pasta with spinach']

title: Colorful Tortellini Salad
description: Cook tortellini in salted boiling water, according to package directions. Drain, let cool slightly, transfer to a large bowl. Add vegetables, 3 tablespoons olive oil and lemon juice and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle pasta with yogurt and serve sprinkled with parsley.

title: Fruity Pasta Salad
description: Mix the sour cream with honey, sparkling wine and orange zest and juice (to taste). Mix the pasta just before serving with the dressing, strawberries and half the mint. Transfer to plates and garnish with the remaining mint.

title: Pork Rolls with Pasta
description: Place the pork between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and with the flat side of a meat mallet or the bottom of a pan, flatten the cutlets. Season with salt and pepper and brush evenly with a little mustard. Place 2 slices of bacon and 3 sage leaves on top of each cutlet and roll up. Secure with one or two wooden skewers. Heat the oil in a Dutch oven and saute the rolls on all sides, remove.

title: Mediterranean Pasta Salad
description: Rinse spinach thoroughly and blanch in boiling salted water for 2 minutes. Drain, rinse in cold water and drain well. Cut olives in half and mix with all prepared ingredients in a bowl. Mix vinegar with salt and mustard. Peel garlic, squeeze through a press into the vinegar mixture, whisk in oil and season with pepper. Drizzle the dressing over the salad.

title: Spaghetti with Squid
description: Peel garlic and onion and chop finely. Rinse and chop chile (removing seeds if desired).

title: Large Pasta Shells with Spinach Filling
description: Rinse spinach, trim, cook briefly in boiling salted water until wilted and drain. Chop wilted spinach on a cutting board and press against a sieve to remove liquid.

title: Green Tagliatelle with Gorgonzola
description: Cook tagliatelle until al dente in boiling salted water. Drain, setting some cooking water aside. Coat noodles in the sauce and toss. Add 2-3 tablespoons of the cooking water and the parsley, stir well and serve immediately.

title: Vegetarian Lasagna with Mushrooms
description: The dietary fibres in this dish, which are abundant, stimulate the digestion and ensure long-lasting satiety.

title: Spicy Pepper Steak with Linguine
description: Peel and chop onions and garlic. Rinse bell peppers, trim and cut into strips.

title: Pasta with Peas and Green Asparagus
description: Cook the pasta shells in boiling salted water until al dente. Heat the oil in a large sauté pan, add the vegetables and toss briefly. Add salt, pepper and lemon juice and mix in the drained pasta. Finally, add the mint and garnish with Parmesan.

title: Pasta with Balsamic Lentils and Arugula
description: Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until al dente and drain. Mix pasta with the lentils, toss and serve with arugula.

title: Pasta with Tomato Sauce and Grated Parmesan Cheese
description: Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large frying pan and saute the onion gently. Add the tomatoes with 3 tablespoons water and the garlic cloves. Cover and simmer for 3-4 minutes over medium heat. Remove the pan from the heat and season with sugar, salt, pepper, nutmeg and cinnamon. Sprinkle the basil over the top, cover and set aside.

title: Spaghetti with Creamy Fennel Sauce
description: Heat 1 tablespoon of butter in a pan, and sauté the fennel for 1-2 minutes. Add another tablespoon of the butter and the cream. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat, and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat. Season to taste with parmesan cheese, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, and nutmeg.

title: Roasted Hen with Peppers
description: Fry onions and garlic in butter until translucent. Stir in tomato paste, paprika and flour briefly, for just a few seconds. Gradually pour in chicken stock and stir until sauce is smooth. Add lemon zest. Place meat in sauce, bring to a boil again and cover.

title: Tortellini with Olive Vinaigrette
description: For the vinaigrette, mix the chile peppers well with olives, vinegar and olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.

title: Cannelloni with Tofu Filling
description: Rinse the spinach thoroughly, cut off the hard stems and place in a pot, dripping wet, over medium heat. Let the water evaporate, then shock in ice-cold water and squeeze well. Chop the spinach finely. Peel the onion and garlic and chop finely.

title: Pasta with Ham and Mushrooms
description: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pan. Add bacon and sauté briefly. Add remaining oil and mushrooms and sauté until the liquid has evaporated, about 5 minutes. Add chiles and oregano, season with salt and pepper and cook 3 minutes more. Divide pasta among plates and top with mushroom sauce.

title: Chicken Breasts with Cream Sauce
description: For the sauce: Heat white wine and chicken stock in a pan and reduce in half, add cream and bring to a boil. Stir in cream cheese and simmer on low heat. Cook pasta in plenty of boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Shrimp and Mussel Pasta

title: Spaghetti with Cream Sauce and Vegetables
description: Melt butter in a small saucepan, add cream and boil over low heat for 2-3 minutes. Let simmer gently. Add Parmesan, stir and season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.

title: Baked Cannelloni with Ground Beef Filling
description: Cover the bottom of a baking dish with a little tomato sauce. Arrange the lasagna noodles in a single layer and place a little meat sauce in the centers, roll up and place seam sides down in the baking dish. Top with the remaining sauce, sprinkle with cheese and bake 20 minutes in an oven preheated to 200°C (approximately 375°F). Garnish with basil before serving.

title: Pappardelle with Vegetables and Cream Sauce
description: Heat butter in a pan. Add diced shallot, leek and celery and cook for about 3 minutes. Then add pumpkin cubes and simmer another 5 minutes. Add orange juice and vegetable broth, bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes over low heat.

title: Kärntner Kasnudeln (German Cheese Filled Potato Dumplings)
description: For the filling: Scrub the potatoes and cook in salted boiling water for about 30 minutes. Peel then press through a potato ricer and let the steam evaporate. Mix in the remaining egg, quark, herbs and cheese. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.

title: Spaghetti with Tomato Ragout
description: Stir in parsley and drained, coarsely chopped tomatoes. Simmer for 5-10 minutes. Season sauce with salt and sugar to taste. Mix the drained spaghetti with the sauce. Grate Parmesan over the spaghetti, garnish with parsley and serve.

title: Fast Tortellini with Shrimp and Vegetables
description: Heat butter in a pan and cook the frozen peas, zucchini and arugula for about 5 minutes. Add shrimp, sear, and cook while covered about 7 minutes. Stir the cream into the pan and season with salt and pepper.

title: Broccoli Pasta

Add the endives and steam for about 2 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Remove from the heat and mix in parsley, anchovies, and Parmesan.

title: Pasta with Red Mullet

Stir in basil, capers and drained pasta and moisten with a little of the pasta cooking water if needed.

title: Fusilli with Vegetables and Tomato Pesto
description: For the vegetables: Scrub the potatoes and cook in a pan of boiling salted water until knife-tender, about 25 minutes, drain. Rinse the vegetables and cut into bite-sized pieces. Blanch the broccoli, broad beans and green beans in a pot of boiling salted water until crisp-tender, about 5 minutes. Drain, rinse under cold water and drain well. Cook the pasta according to package directions until al dente, drain. Cut the potatoes into quarters or eighths, if large. In a pan heat the oil and cook the remaining garlic until soft. Add the broccoli, broad beans, green beans, zucchini and potatoes and saute 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the pasta to the pan along with a little tomato pesto and cook until heated through. Season with salt and pepper and arrange on plates. Garnish with fresh oregano leaves and serve the remaining pesto separately.

description: Boil the pasta in salted water until done cooking.

title: Pasta with Vegetables and Herbs
description: Peel the garlic, chop finely and sweat in a pan with melted butter. Stir in the heavy cream, broth and herbs. Season with salt, pepper, and a dash of lemon and simmer for about 5 minutes over medium heat until thickened. Blend with a hand blender until foamy. Drain the pasta, roll into nests and place in the center of warmed plates. Distribute the vegetables around the pasta, drizzle with the cream sauce and sprinkle with pine nuts. Garnished with basil leaves and serve immediately.

title: Tomato Basil Pasta
description: Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until al dente according to the package directions.

title: Pasta Shells Stuffed with Tuna
description: Drain tuna well and mix in a bowl with capers, tomatoes, peeled garlic, mayonnaise and sour cream. Puree with an immersion blender. Add herbs and season with salt, lemon juice and cayenne pepper. Fill pasta with tuna mixture and serve garnished with walnuts and fresh herbs.

title: Tagliatelle with Truffles
description: Add the ricotta, parmesan, and truffle .Toss well, Season with salt and pepper. Serve the pasta on a warm plate and garnished with freshly grated truffle.

description: Heat the butter in a frying pan and cook on all sides until golden brown. Add the celery and apple slices, sauté briefly and deglaze with the broth.

description: For the sauce: Meanwhile rinse the eggplant, cut into small cubes and sprinkle with salt. Let stand for 10 minutes and pat dry. Add eggplant, sauté briefly and stir in tomatoes. Mix in the freshly chopped oregano and season with salt and pepper.

description: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions in plenty of salted water until al dente. Then drain.

title: Pasta Roll with Ricotta Filling on Tarragon Sauce
description: For the pesto mix remaining tarragon in a bowl with pine nuts and 2 tablespoons Parmesan and season with salt and pepper. Puree with an immersion blender. Gradually incorporate oil until a thick pesto is formed that coats a spoon.

title: Pasta with Blue Cheese and Peppers
description: Heat oil in a saucepan and saute onions and bell peppers in the pan until onions are translucent. Add cream and simmer for 3 minutes. Cut gorgonzola into cubes and mix into sauce. Coarsely chop dill. Add dill to sauce and season with salt and pepper.

description: Melt the butter in a hot pan and sauté the vegetables. Deglaze with the wine, cover and simmer about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Ravioli with Egg Yolk and Truffles
description: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.

title: Pasta with Carbonara Sauce and Smoked Eel
description: In a pan, heat the oil and sauté the garlic for 1-2 minutes, until translucent. Add the chives and pour in the cream. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Simmer for about 5 minutes, add the drained pasta and Parmesan and toss to coat.

title: Classical Cannelloni
description: Peel the garlic, chop finely and mix with half the tomatoes. Mix the tomatoes with salt, pepper, sugar, and wine. Knead the ground beef with the onions, remaining garlic, egg, mustard, and thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Fill the uncooked cannelloni noodles with the ground beef mixture. Place them side by side in a greased baking dish. Spread the tomato sauce over the noodles and sprinkle with cheese. Cook in the oven for about 40 minutes. To serve, garnish with fresh herbs and serve with a small salad, if desired.

title: Pasta with Olives, Tuna and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
description: Pour the sauce over the drained pasta and garnish with basil. Serve sprinkled with Parmesan.

title: Lasagna Noodles with Bacon, Peppers and Sage
description: Rinse peppers, cut in half, remove seeds and ribs and cut into bite-size pieces. Cut bacon into pieces. Peel onion and garlic and finely chop. Rinse sage, shake dry and pluck off leaves.

title: Pasta with Sun-Dried Tomatoes, Eggplant and Capers
description: Peel garlic and finely chop. Cut tomato into strips. Grill the eggplant in 2 tablespoons hot oil in a grill pan for 1-2 minutes on each side and season with salt and pepper.

title: Tagliatelle with Mushroom and Tomato Sugo
description: Peel garlic and chop finely. Trim the mushrooms. Depending on size, leave whole or cut into slices. Fry in hot oil with the garlic until golden brown, 2-3 minutes.

title: Linguine with Salmon, Bell Peppers and Zucchini
description: Cook zucchini pieces with bell peppers in boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes, remove, rinse and drain.

title: Pasta with Green Olives, Ham and Parmesan
description: Add olives, chopped lemon basil and drained spaghetti to the pan with half of the Parmesan, mix well and season with salt and pepper. Arrange on plates, sprinkle with the remaining Parmesan and garnish with lemon basil.

title: Pasta with Peas, Bacon and Parmesan
description: Cut bacon into strips. Peel garlic and chop finely. Heat oil in a pan and saute garlic and bacon for 2-3 minutes. Add broth and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Add creme fraiche and season with salt and pepper. Add drained pasta and peas, toss and arrange on plates. Sprinkle with freshly grated cheese and serve.

title: Farfalle with Chicken, Olives and Red Onion
description: In a pan, fry chicken pieces in hot oil until browned. Season with salt and pepper, remove and set aside. In the remaining fat, fry onion slices 1-2 minutes. Add spinach and olives and cook 2-3 minutes more.

title: Tagiatelle with Beans and Tomato Sauce
description: Rinse and halve the tomatoes. Peel the shallots and garlic, chop finely and fry in hot oil both. Add beans and deglaze with the white wine. Simmer about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and thyme and simmer 1-2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and toss with the drained tagiatelle. Serve in bowls.

title: Orecchiette with Peas, Leeks and Cream Sauce
description: Rinse leeks, trim and cut into rings. Peel garlic and chop finely. Sauté along with the leeks for 1-2 minutes in hot butter. Add the peas and pour in the broth. Add cream and cook until sauce is slightly creamy and the leeks are al dente, about 5 minutes. Mix in half of the Parmesan and season with salt and pepper. Add the drained orrechiette to pan, mix well and arrange on plates. Sprinkle with the remaining Parmesan and serve garnished with lemon zest.

title: Chinese Style Dumplings
description: For the dough, mix together the water, flour and a pinch of salt. Knead well until a smooth, elastic dough is formed, which no longer sticks to the hands. Add water or flour if necessary. Cover and set aside for 1/2 hour.

title: Classic Lasagna Casserole
description: Peel and finely chop the onion and garlic. Peel the carrots, and rinse the celery. Finely dice both the celery and carrots. Slice the mozzarella and tomatoes.

title: Baked Ravioli with Tomato Sauce
description: For the filling, rinse the herbs and blanch in salted water. Squeeze the excess water and chop finely. Peel the shallot and the garlic and chop finely. Sauté in hot butter until translucent. Mix with the herbs, cream cheese, and Parmesan. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.

title: Ravioli with Spinach and Parmesan
description: For the filling, rinse the spinach, and blanch for 2 minutes a large pot of salted water. Drain, squeeze dry and chop coarsely. Peel the onion, chop finely and sauté in butter until translucent. Stir in flour, let cook briefly. Add the milk, bring to a simmer while stirring and cook gently for about 5 minutes over low heat. Remove from heat, add the spinach, season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg.

title: Pasta with Tomatoes and Herbs

title: Tomato Sauce
description: In a saucepan, heat the oil and sauté the onion, garlic, and chile cubes along with the pine nuts for 2-3 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes and the prepared vegetables. title: Pasta with Sage and Parmesan
description: Cut the sage leaves into thin strips. Heat 3-4 tablespoons of oil in a small pan. Gently fry the leaves and then remove the leaves once crisp. Be careful the oil doesn't get too hot.

title: Spicy Tagliatelle with Chanterelles and Cherry Tomatoes
description: Rinse the thyme and parsley, shake dry and chop coarsely. Rinse the meat, pat dry and cut into bite-sized cubes. Cook the tagiatelle in boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Tagliatelle with Chicken and Lime-Herb Vinaigrette
description: Cook pasta in boiling salted water until al dente for 10-15 minutes. Rinse chicken breasts, pat dry and slice. Season chicken slices with salt and pepper, then fry in hot oil in a grill pan for 3-4 minutes. Remove chicken from pan and bake in preheated oven for 10-12 minutes.

title: Pasta with Chicken, Vegetables, and Mozzarella
description: Preheat the oven to 180°C (approximately 350°F). Cook the fusilli in plenty of salted water according to the package directions until al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water. Cut the mozzarella into small cubes. Grease a baking pan with butter. Mix the pasta with the vegetables, the meat, and the mozzarella. Season to taste and transfer to the pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Serve sprinkled with chopped parsley.

title: Pasta with Tuna, Tomato Sauce and Olives
description: Rinse the parsley and chop finely. Rinse the chile pepper, remove the seeds and cut into strips. Cook penne in plenty of boiling salted water according to package directions until al dente. Toss cooked pasta with the tuna-tomato sauce. Serve garnished with chile pepper, olives and chopped parsley.

title: Broccoli Lasagna with Ham
description: Peel the shallot and garlic, chop and sauté until translucent in hot butter. Sprinkle with flour and deglaze with the white wine. Stir vigorously with a whisk, so that no lumps form. Bring to a boil, then stir in the milk. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until creamy.

title: Colorful Lasagna
description: Preheat oven to 200°C (fan: 180°C, gas mark 3)(approximately 400°F/convection 350°F). Rinse bell peppers and cut into quarters. Brush bell peppers with oil and place with skin side up on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Roast under the broiler until blackened and blistered, watching carefully, about 10 minutes. Remove from oven and cover with a damp kitchen towel. Allow peppers to cool and remove skin.

title: Ham and Basil Noodle Casserole
description: Coarsely chop the bacon. Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until al dente, drain, rinse and drain again. Grease a large oval baking dish. Peel the onions and garlic, chop and sauté with the bacon in a hot pan with oil. Rinse the basil, shake dry, pluck off the leaves and chop finely. Whisk the cream with the eggs, 1/2 of the cheese and the basil and season with salt and pepper. Mix in the bacon-onion mixture then stir into the pasta. Transfer to the prepared baking dish, sprinkle with chopped butter and the remaining cheese and bake until golden brown, about 25-30 minutes. Serve immediately.

title: Ham-Filled Dumplings with Lamb Sauce
description: For the lamb sauce, chop lamb meat into very small pieces. Peel onion and carrot and finely chop. Heat oil and brown lamb pieces. Add onions and carrots and sauté. Pour in lamb stock and season with salt and pepper. Add vinegar, bay leaf and thyme, cover and simmer for about 40 minutes. Thicken sauce as desired with cornstarch mixed in cold water.

title: Red Mullet with Rice Noodles
description: Sauté the scallions in hot oil in a wok and pour in the stock. Add the fish and the chili sauce. Cover and let stand about 5-6 minutes. Then remove the fish and add the noodles to the wok. Add soy sauce to taste and toss with ingredients in the wok to combine. Arrange noodles and fish together on warmed plates and serve.

title: Pot Roast
description: Peel the onions, carrots, celery root and garlic and roughly chop. Chop pancetta finely and fry in hot oil. Take out of pan, lightly salt the beef roast, season with pepper and brown in a roasting pan on all sides. Remove roast and fry the vegetables until browned. Sprinkle with the flour and pour in the red wine and some broth. Place the meat, bay leaf and juniper berries in the pan, cover and allow to simmer gently for about 3 hours over low heat. Turn the roast occasionally and pour in the remaining broth as needed.

title: Spaghetti Aglio, Olio E Peperoncino
description: Heat the olive oil in a skillet and cook the garlic and chili peppers until fragrant, about 1 minutes. Add the hot spaghetti and parsley, and toss until combined with the oil, garlic and chillies. Season with salt and pepper. Serve on warmed plates.

title: Fusilli with Bell Peppers, Capers and Parmesan
description: Sauté garlic briefly in hot oil. Add bell peppers and tomatoes to the pan and deglaze with red wine. Simmer for 3-4 minutes. Then add capers and the drained fusilli and season with salt and cayenne pepper. Transfer to plates and serve sprinkled with Parmesan.

title: Tagliatelle with Snow Peas
description: Cook the pasta in boiling salted water until al dente.

title: Swabian-Style Ravioli
description: For the filling, cut bacon and 1 peeled onion into small cubes. Rinse spinach leaves, blanch, drain, squeeze well and finely chop. Melt butter in a skillet and sauté bacon and onions. Add spinach to skillet and sauté briefly, remove from heat and let cool.

title: Pasta with Broccoli
description: Peel and finely chop the garlic. Heat the olive oil and saute the broccoli and garlic. Rinse the pepper, halve, remove the seeds and cut into rings. Saute the pepper. Pour in 150 ml (approximately 2/3 cup) of the broccoli broth. Pour in the drained pasta and toss. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

title: Colorful Pasta with Chicken Breasts and Feta
description: Rinse the chicken breasts and pat dry. Pluck Thai basil leaves. Bring the white wine to a boil in a pot, add basil stems and place chicken breasts in a steamer basket over the pot. Cover and cook about 8-10 minutes. Remove, allow to cool and cut into strips.

title: Linguine with Zucchini and Lemon
description: For the sauce: Peel and finely chop the garlic.

title: Pasta with Seafood and Mint
description: For the noodles: Combine flour with eggs, olive oil, salt and possibly some water and knead into a firm, smooth dough. Rinse mint, pat dry, pluck leaves and chop finely. Knead mint into dough and cover in plastic wrap and let rest about 30 minutes.

title: Pork, Broccoli, and Rice Noodle Stir-Fry
description: Cook the rice noodles according to the package directions for al dente. Drain in a colander.

title: Sweet Pasta Salad with Blackberries and Almonds

title: Artichoke Pasta Salad with Cherry Tomatoes
description: Remove the woody leaves of the artichokes and cut off remaining leaf tips with kitchen shears. Cut artichokes lengthwise into quarters, cook for about 12-15 minutes in boiling salted water and drain. Rinse scallions, trim and cut into rings. Rinse and halve the tomatoes. Fry the artichokes in hot olive oil in a pan on all sides, add the olives and scallions, press the garlic through a press into the pan and stir in thyme. Cook briefly, remove from heat and mix with lemon juice, tomatoes and pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with arugula and basil.

title: Meatballs with Tomato Sauce

title: Ravioli with Onions and Spinach
description: For the filling: Peel onion and chop finely. Wash scallions and cut into thin rings. Rinse spinach thoroughly, blanch in lightly salted boiling water, rinse with cold water, squeeze well and finely chop the leaves. Cut roll into small cubes and soak in warm milk. Cut bacon into cubes. Melt butter and lightly sauté onion and scallion.

title: Lasagna with Meat Sauce
description: Combine flour, eggs, oil and 1 teaspoon salt in a mixing bowl. Add water as needed and knead to form a dough. Wrap dough in a kitchen towel and let rest for 30 minutes.

title: Lasagna with Wild Salmon
description: Cut the salmon fillets into thin slices, season with salt and pepper and drizzle with lemon juice.

title: Pasta with Creamy Salmon Sauce
description: Cut salmon into small pieces. Peel garlic and chop finely. Heat butter in a pan and saute garlic briefly, deglaze  pan with white wine. Boil down a little bit and addcream. Simmer for a few seconds and add creme fraiche, parsley and horseradish.

title: Chicken Lasagne
description: Boil the chicken breast in poultry stock and cook for 15 minutes over low heat. Remove the chicken breast and drain. Chop the chicken breast finely with a large knife. Mix with 2 tablespoons oil, lemon zest and nutmeg, season with salt and pepper, and mix thoroughly. Leave for 15 minutes.

title: Meat Lasagna
description: Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a casserole and saute bacon and prepared vegetables. Add ground beef and saute, stirring, until crumbly. Add tomato paste, oregano and broth. Season with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer for about 20 minutes.

title: Oven Baked Lasagna
description: For the bechamel, melt butter in a pot. Whisk in flour. Mix milk and cream together and gradually pour into mixture while stiring. Bring to a boil. Cook for approximately 1 minute and the remove from heat. Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg.

title: Beef and Pork Lasagna
description: For the lasagna, peel and chop the onion, carrot and garlic. Fry, with the pancetta in a pan with some olive oil. Add the ground meat and cook until crumbly. Pour in the wine and allow it to boil over high heat.

title: Summer Vegetables with Pasta
description: Rinse and halve the tomatoes. Peel the onions and cut in half. Heat some oil in a pan and fry the eggplant slices over medium heat, until golden brown on both sides. De-grease slightly on absorbent paper and season with salt and pepper. Fry the onion halves in the remaining oil until golden yellow. Add a little more oil if necessary. Sauté the tomato halves briefly and season with salt and pepper.

title: Deconstructed Vegetable Lasagne
description: Roll out dough on a floured surface to about 2 mm (approximately 1/15 inch) thick. Cut into 20x10 cm (approximately 8x4 inch) rectangles. Let noodles dry on a tea towel.

title: Lasagna with Fontina Cheese
description: For the béchamel, melt the butter. Add the flour, stir to combine, and briefly cook. Gradually incorporate the milk, stirring constantly, then bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute, then remove from the heat. Add the lemon zest, and season to taste with salt and pepper.

title: Pasta with Pesto
description: For the pesto, rinse the basil and pluck the leaves. Pat dry. Peel and coarsely chop the garlic. Roast the pine nuts in a dry frying pan over medium heat, until golden brown. Allow to cool. Puree the pine nuts, basil, garlic and cheese. Season with salt.

title: Orecchiette with Broccoli, Chile and Parmesan
description: Season the mixture with salt, pepper and Aleppo pepper. Add the noodles and toss until they are well coated. Serve with the grated Parmesan.

title: Cannelloni with Cheese Sauce
description: 90 mins

title: Spinach Cannelloni with Pine Nuts
description: Press the garlic and stir into the ricotta. Toast the pine nuts in a dry pan until golden. Allow to cool, coarsely chop and mix into the ricotta. Rinse spinach, trim, and blanch in boiling salted water for 2-3 minutes, drain well and chop coarsely. Add the spinach to the ricotta mixture. Spoon the mixture into a piping bag.

title: Cannelloni Gratin with Vegetable Sauce
description: Combine ground meat with remaining onions, remaining garlic, egg and squeezed bread. Season with salt, mustard and pepper. Fill cannelloni with meat mixture and arrange in an oiled baking pan. Spread vegetable sauce over pasta. Drizzle with cream and sprinkle with cheese.

title: Spaghetti with Venus Clams
description: Peel and finely dice the shallot and garlic. Rinse the clams thoroughly.

title: Fish Lasagna
description: Cook lasagna noodles in plenty of salted water until al dente. Lift out noodles using a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen towels.

title: Meat Lasagna
description: Melt butter in a pot. Stir in flour and fry briefly. Gradually pour in milk while stirring, season with salt and pepper and let béchamel sauce simmer over low heat for about 5 minutes while stirring. Add thyme.

title: Tagliatelle with Bacon and Radicchio
description: Sauté the radicchio briefly in butter, then mix with the noodles. Divide onto plates. Top with the sauce, and garnish with the chervil.

title: Pasta with Pork and Goat Cheese
description: Meanwhile, rinse the pork tenderloin, pat dry and cut into strips. Saute in 2 tablespoons of hot oil until golden brown for 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Rinse and halve the tomatoes.

title: Asian Beef Vegetable Fry with Pasta
description: Sear the meat in 2 tablespoons of hot oil in a wok for 3 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon of soy sauce and season with salt and pepper. Remove and keep warm.
types: ['Beef', 'Ragout', 'Beef Ragout', 'skillet dish', 'skillet vegetables', 'skillet noodle dish', 'Asian', 'Cooking on vacation', 'Meal for Four', 'Guest', 'Spicy', 'weekend cooking', 'Meat', 'fruit-vegetable', 'Legume', 'Spices', 'Pasta', 'mushroom', 'Lunch', 'Main Course']

title: Pasta with Tomatoes, Olives and Tuna
description: Add olives. Drain tuna and separate into smaller pieces. Add to the sauce. Drain pasta and toss with sauce. Arrange on plates and sprinkle with parsley. Serve.
